context.natural_language_question: Which papers did the author Gennady L. Andrienko write?
context.instruction: Given the information above, produce a SPARQL query for KG2. In your answer please highlight the final,complete SPARQL query within the tags '<sparql>' and '</sparql>'. For the author use the following logic: hasAuthorship ?authorship . ?authorship :hasAuthor ?author . ?author and the ORCID "https://dbpedia.org/ontology/orcidId".

sparql_query_kg2:
To create a SPARQL query for Knowledge Graph 2 (OpenAlex) that retrieves the papers authored by Gennady L. Andrienko, we need to map the entities and relations from DBLP to OpenAlex. Based on the provided mappings, we will use the ORCID identifier for the author and the appropriate relations.

Here is the final SPARQL query for KG2:

```sparql
SELECT DISTINCT ?answer WHERE {
  ?answer <https://semopenalex.org/ontology/hasAuthorship> ?authorship .
  ?authorship <https://semopenalex.org/ontology/hasAuthor> ?author .
  ?author <https://dbpedia.org/ontology/orcidId> "https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8574-6295" .
}
```

context.natural_language_question: Which publications did Maia Rohm author?
context.instruction: Given the information above, produce a SPARQL query for KG2. In your answer please highlight the final,complete SPARQL query within the tags '<sparql>' and '</sparql>'. For the author use the following logic: hasAuthorship ?authorship . ?authorship :hasAuthor ?author . ?author and the ORCID "https://dbpedia.org/ontology/orcidId".

sparql_query_kg2:
To generate the SPARQL query for the OpenAlex knowledge graph based on the provided mappings and logic, you can use the following query:

```sparql
PREFIX oa: <https://semopenalex.org/ontology/>
PREFIX db: <https://dbpedia.org/ontology/>

SELECT DISTINCT ?answer WHERE {
  ?answer oa:hasAuthorship ?authorship .
  ?authorship oa:hasAuthor ?author .
  ?author db:orcidId "https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5108-6874" .
}
```

This query retrieves distinct publications authored by Maia Rohm using the mappings and relationships defined in the OpenAlex knowledge graph.

context.natural_language_question: What are the papers written by the person A. V. Thakur?
context.instruction: Given the information above, produce a SPARQL query for KG2. In your answer please highlight the final,complete SPARQL query within the tags '<sparql>' and '</sparql>'. For the author use the following logic: hasAuthorship ?authorship . ?authorship :hasAuthor ?author . ?author and the ORCID "https://dbpedia.org/ontology/orcidId".

sparql_query_kg2:
Given the context and the entity and relation mapping, we need to create a SPARQL query for Knowledge Graph 2 (OpenAlex) to retrieve the papers written by the person A. V. Thakur. Based on the provided mapping, we know that the ORCID for A. V. Thakur in OpenAlex is "https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3166-1517" and that the relationship for authorship is mapped to "https://semopenalex.org/ontology/hasAuthorship" and "https://semopenalex.org/ontology/hasAuthor".

Here's the SPARQL query for KG2:

```sparql
PREFIX semopenalex: <https://semopenalex.org/ontology/>
PREFIX dbpedia: <https://dbpedia.org/ontology/>

SELECT DISTINCT ?answer WHERE {
  ?answer semopenalex:hasAuthorship ?authorship .
  ?authorship semopenalex:hasAuthor ?author .
  ?author dbpedia:orcidId "https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3166-1517" .
}
```

This query finds distinct papers (`?answer`) that have an authorship relationship (`semopenalex:hasAuthorship`) with an authorship entity (`?authorship`), which in turn has an author (`semopenalex:hasAuthor`) with the specified ORCID (`dbpedia:orcidId`).

context.natural_language_question: Which papers did Richard Bowden publish in the last eight years?
context.instruction: Given the information above, produce a SPARQL query for KG2. In your answer please highlight the final,complete SPARQL query within the tags '<sparql>' and '</sparql>'. For the author use the following logic: hasAuthorship ?authorship . ?authorship :hasAuthor ?author . ?author and the ORCID "https://dbpedia.org/ontology/orcidId".

sparql_query_kg2:
Sure, based on the provided context and entity/relation mappings, here is the SPARQL query for Knowledge Graph 2 (OpenAlex):

```sparql
SELECT DISTINCT ?answer WHERE {
  ?answer <https://semopenalex.org/ontology/hasAuthorship> ?authorship .
  ?authorship <https://semopenalex.org/ontology/hasAuthor> ?author .
  ?author <http://dbpedia.org/ontology/orcidId> "https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3285-8020" .
  ?answer <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/hasPublicationYear> ?y
  FILTER(?y > YEAR(NOW())-8)
}
```

This query retrieves the papers authored by Richard Bowden (identified by the ORCID "https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3285-8020") within the last eight years from the OpenAlex knowledge graph.

context.natural_language_question: List the papers published by Neil McGlohon in the last 5 years.
context.instruction: Given the information above, produce a SPARQL query for KG2. In your answer please highlight the final,complete SPARQL query within the tags '<sparql>' and '</sparql>'. For the author use the following logic: hasAuthorship ?authorship . ?authorship :hasAuthor ?author . ?author and the ORCID "https://dbpedia.org/ontology/orcidId".

sparql_query_kg2:
Certainly! Below is the SPARQL query for Knowledge Graph 2 (OpenAlex) based on the given mappings and logic:

```sparql
PREFIX fabio: <http://purl.org/spar/fabio/>
PREFIX semoa: <https://semopenalex.org/ontology/>
PREFIX dbo: <http://dbpedia.org/ontology/>

SELECT DISTINCT ?answer WHERE {
  ?answer semoa:hasAuthorship ?authorship .
  ?authorship semoa:hasAuthor ?author .
  ?author dbo:orcidId "https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8304-4911" .
  ?answer fabio:hasPublicationYear ?y .
  FILTER (?y > YEAR(NOW())-5)
}
```

This query retrieves the papers authored by Neil McGlohon in the last 5 years from the OpenAlex knowledge graph, using the specified mappings and logic.

sparql_query_kg2:
